page.title: 05Roads Near Woodsetts
page.content: The main direction of travelling in our block is east to west along the {A57.}The A57 was built in{1764}as the {Attercliffe to Worksop Turnpike. Before the A57 was built there wasnt any roads going east to west so the main way of traveling then was north to south. The A57 is a very busy road and lots of cars lorrys and buses use it.Most of the traffic will be going to{Worksop or Sheffield}or to the{M1 {motorway .}There is a crossroads in Woodsetts one road leads to {Gildingwells}and one to{Worksop}one leads to Dinnington but one only leads to the Common. There are a lot of tractors in Woodsetts because there are 3 farms{Hoades Farm,Grange Farm and{Bealbys Farm.
